annotations.label: PROJECT_NAME
annotations.text: CONSTRUCTION OF MOREH BYPASS ON NH-39 NEAR INDO-MYANMAR BORDER IN THE STATE OF MANIPUR.

annotations.label: CONSULTANT_NAME
annotations.text: M/s Choice Consultancy Services Pvt. Ltd.

annotations.label: CONSULTANT_ADDRESS
annotations.text: Shree Shakambhari Corporate Park, 156-158 Chakravarti Ashok Society, J B Nagar, Andheri (E), Mumbai - 99, India

annotations.label: PROJECT_RATIONALE
annotations.text: No proper Geometry of road alignment

annotations.label: PROJECT_RATIONALE
annotations.text: Blind Curve on the project road

annotations.label: PROJECT_RATIONALE
annotations.text: Cross drainage - poor condition and inadequate.

annotations.label: PROJECT_RATIONALE
annotations.text: Curve radius less than what is required for the ruling Design speed of 40 km / hr. in roads for steep terrain.

annotations.label: PROJECT_RATIONALE
annotations.text: Deficient curves and reverse curves in roads of plain terrain without transition length for safe reversal of elevation.

annotations.label: PAVEMENT_CONDITION
annotations.text: Poor pavement condition and structurally inadequate.

annotations.label: INTERNATIONAL_CONNECTIVITY
annotations.text: Indo-Myanmar Border to Land Custom Port of India

annotations.label: TABLE_TITLE
annotations.text: Table 1.2: Salient Features of the Proposed Road

annotations.label: ROAD_STANDARD
annotations.text: Most of the horizontal curves including the reverse ones have been improved to achieve required design speed and super elevation reversal for riding safety and comfort in conformation to MORTH standards. The vertical alignment of the existing road is proposed as per Hill Road Specification.

annotations.label: DESIGN_SPEED
annotations.text: Ruling = 40 km/h, Limiting = 30 Km/h, Hair Pin Bend = 20 Km/h

annotations.label: PROPOSED_ROW
annotations.text: Proposed ROW is 20m and 24m in general.

annotations.label: FOREST_CLEARANCE_STATUS
annotations.text: Online forest and wild life proposal was submitted. And same is under progress.

annotations.label: PROJECT_RATIONALE
annotations.text: The proposed Moreh Integrated check post will facilitate speedy movement of export- import consignments and reduce any inconvenience to the general public from any increase in trade. But the existing bypass which joins it with national highway is in very poor condition. If the bypass facilitates smooth riding and speedy movement; the ICP will get more importance.

annotations.label: FIGURE_TITLE
annotations.text: Figure 3-6: Details of Villages of Project Corridor

annotations.label: PAVEMENT_CONDITION
annotations.text: The existing pavement is generally flexible in nature except in some area where no road is available. The average carriageway width of the road has 3.75 meters without earthen shoulders on either side. Visual inspection of the road showed a very bad surface condition. Approximate 20-30 % of the highway accepts damaged riding surface but existing bypass road isn't in good condition and new construction of the same can be recommended.

annotations.label: TABLE_TITLE
annotations.text: Table 3.3: Pavement Condition along the alignment

annotations.label: PAVEMENT_CONDITION
annotations.text: The pavement condition is very poor, cracks and vertical settlement observed.

annotations.label: PAVEMENT_CONDITION
annotations.text: An earthen roadway of an average width 3.75m. There are so many potholes on road due to improper drainage system, lac of design etc.

annotations.label: PAVEMENT_CONDITION
annotations.text: The pavement is showing signs of distress, due to: Lack of pavement drainage. Inadequate pavement thickness and composition. Inadequate maintenance. The defects noticed are: Cracking (alligator, transverse, longitudinal, edge) Rutting, Raveling Potholes, rain cuts.
